action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: starting with a common five-letter word containing frequent vowels (a, e) and consonants (c, r, n) to maximize feedback.  
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = imply
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: all letters in "crane" are excluded; next guess uses different vowels (o) and common consonants (s, t, m, p) not in the first attempt.  
guess: stomp

attempts = 2
target_word = imply
guess = stomp
guess_feedback = s<red> t<red> o<red> m<yellow> p<yellow>

guess_feedback: s<red> t<red> o<red> m<yellow> p<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: feedback shows "m" and "p" are in the word but not in positions 4-5. "lumpy" includes both, places "m" in position 3 (new) and "p" in position 4 (not excluded). Uses new vowels (u, y) and avoids prior excluded letters.  
guess: lumpy

attempts = 3
target_word = imply
guess = lumpy
guess_feedback = l<yellow> u<red> m<yellow> p<yellow> y<green>

guess_feedback: l<yellow> u<red> m<yellow> p<yellow> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "y" is confirmed in position 5. "l", "m", "p" must be repositioned (excluded from positions 1,3,4). "imply" places "m" in position 2 (new), "p" in 3 (new), "l" in 4 (new), and introduces "i" (untested vowel).  
guess: imply

attempts = 4
target_word = imply
guess = imply
guess_feedback = i<green> m<green> p<green> l<green> y<green>

guess_explanation: starting with a common five-letter word containing frequent vowels (a, e) and consonants (c, r, n) to maximize feedback.
all letters in "crane" are excluded; next guess uses different vowels (o) and common consonants (s, t, m, p) not in the first attempt.

feedback shows "m" and "p" are in the word but not in positions 4-5. "lumpy" includes both, places "m" in position 3 (new) and "p" in position 4 (not excluded). Uses new vowels (u, y) and avoids prior excluded letters.

"y" is confirmed in position 5. "l", "m", "p" must be repositioned (excluded from positions 1,3,4). "imply" places "m" in position 2 (new), "p" in 3 (new), "l" in 4 (new), and introduces "i" (untested vowel).
